cards.heading: Is this something to worry about?
cards.description: Relationships for you might feel like walking on a swinging bridge: you long to cross and connect but hesitate, fearing the instability beneath your feet. Your high avoidant tendencies may push you to withdraw, your anxiety might pull you toward overthinking connections, and your secure tendencies create a hopeful foundation that relationships can work with effort. You’re navigating a mix of tension, growth, and stability.

dynamic_description.text: Relationships for you might feel like walking on a swinging bridge: you long to cross and connect but hesitate, fearing the instability beneath your feet. Your high avoidant tendencies may push you to withdraw, your anxiety might pull you toward overthinking connections, and your secure tendencies create a hopeful foundation that relationships can work with effort. {{PARTA}} .

data.substitute: You’re navigating a mix of tension, growth, and stability

dynamic_description.text: Think of relationships like a dance. Some people flow effortlessly with their partner, sensing when to move closer and when to step back. Attachment is the emotional bond that forms our foundation for connecting with others. Attachment reflects {{PARTA}} . This score means you have conflicting feelings but also resilience in relationships. There’s no need to worry; awareness is the first step to growth Attachment is the way we have learned to give and receive love, shaped by past experiences.

data.substitute: how you seek love and connection

cards.heading: Can you tell me where this is coming from?
pointers: Abandonment
Romantic relationships
Closeness

cards.heading: Make a conscious effort to reduce this to improve your resilience
pointers: Dependency
Romantic relationships
Closeness

cards.heading: Our expert psychologist wants you to know
cards.description: "You’re carrying a mix of trust, fear, and hope—and that’s okay. Recognizing these patterns gives you the power to shift them. Lean into your secure tendencies; they’re a strong foundation to build fulfilling relationships. Growth takes patience, and you’re already on the right path."

cards.heading: Within this score range, you can notice the following behaviors
cards.description: While it differs from people to people, some common things to lookout for
pointers: Within this score range, you can notice the following behaviors,
Fluctuating between closeness and withdrawal in relationships.
Overanalyzing interactions, leading to mental fatigue.
Feeling emotionally overwhelmed yet craving emotional safety.
Experiencing tension headaches or tightness in your chest during relational stress.
Difficulty trusting, even when trust is earned.

report.heading: What are recommendations for your support system?

cards.heading: Relationship support that can help you thrive
cards.description: Healthy relationships play a pivotal role in life. Here's a few things you can say to those close to you:
cards.info: There are ways you can receive support from your closed ones:
pointers: Healthy relationships are pivotal for life. To those close to you, you could share a message on the lines of:
Your support means the world to me, even when I struggle to say it. Here’s how you can help me feel more secure:
Be patient with me when I pull back or overthink.
Offer gentle reassurance without pressure.
Remind me of the safety in our connection through small, consistent actions.
Allow me to process emotions at my own pace without feeling rushed.
Be transparent about your feelings—it helps me trust more.

cards.heading: Workplace accommodations that will help you thrive
cards.description: Share this at your workplace to help navigate relationships.
cards.info: Take a moment to go through and share with your team members and if necessary, with supervisors:
pointers: Share this at your workplace to help navigate relationships at work easier.
I work best in environments that feel predictable and supportive. Here’s how you can help me thrive:
Provide clear communication about expectations.
Create opportunities for teamwork without forcing collaboration.
Encourage regular check-ins to discuss challenges or progress.
Avoid sudden changes without preparation—they can feel destabilizing.
Recognize effort, even in small ways, to foster a sense of belonging.

footer.heading: Take a screenshot and share this with your partner/manager/family

cards.heading: Not a Bookworm? Try This Movie Instead

report.description: Based on your score, here's how you can dive deeper into understanding and improving your emotional well-being:

cards.heading: Small Hack
cards.description: Small hack: When overwhelmed, pause to name your feelings out loud: “I feel anxious about this task” or “I’m withdrawing because I’m uncertain.” Labeling emotions helps reduce their intensity and brings clarity.

dynamic_description.text: You can share this report with our expert psychologists {{THERAPIST_1}} and {{THERAPIST_2}} who specialise in working with your concerns.

report.heading: Closing Note
report.description:
You are a blend of strength and sensitivity, and that’s a beautiful thing. Relationships aren’t about being perfect—they’re about growing together. Self-compassion is a concept that invites you to treat yourself as you would a close friend: with kindness, patience, and understanding. You deserve that care.

With love,
MindPeers
